Good Comments: Took Spoon's TV softsubs and removed OP/ED translations for DVD release. Agenda-based subbing.
Songs not translated, most awkward and inaccurate translations for dialogue out of any version.
DVD rips, good translations, used translations notes where the original Japanese words need to be used to understand certain jokes.  Best choice for this show.
They were very careful and explicit in capturing the words on signs throughout the anime which I feel is a detail sometimes overlooked
Bad Comments: Upscaled video, blurry subtitles. Stick to the Shintani-Spoon release.
Best release for this series. To the guy complaining about upscale: It's encoded in DVD source resolution, it is NOT upscale.
Best subs available, nice surprise to see a less common group
Good translation notes, though I wish they would have subbed the OP/ED.

Good Comments: Pointless subtractive remux of E-D's release. Just add your song-hating/weeaboofied/typeset subs and leave the original subs and audio tracks alone, kthx.
TK-Y + DVD + some translation fixed but no Karaoke for opening and ending

Subbed Projects.Show Name: Kimi ga Aruji de Shitsuji ga Ore de

Good Comments: Removes song translations that were already present in the DVD subs they edited. Inane agenda-based subbing.
Songs not translated, some signs missing (beyond TV-DVD differences), poor styling on some other signs, added huge blog-post-esque trolling messages to the ends of episodes.
Actually do a good job with a.f.k.'s TLs. DVDrips are nice.
Besides minor errors, high quality, fluent, and accurate.
Doesn't like karaoke, so he didn't feel the need to translate it. What a fag.

(Most) signs are subbed and there are no problems with translation, but there is no karaoke and each time you have to manually disable the end notes which cover the end cards. Meme subs rather than a serious endeavor.
Bad Comments: too much screen text untranslated, several mistakes, and very poor translation of puns
Though it seems the subs are ripped from other sources, the typesetting and overall quality are very good.

I regret watching this over a.f.k.'s release. Translation errors, no karaoke, and the version I downloaded had timing issues with the subs. At least it was close to 720p quality, but it wasn't really worth it. Just stick with a.f.k.
